## Plantuml diagramming Guidelines for code reviews

- Create plantuml diagrams in the PR overview.
- Use plantuml syntax for all diagrams.
- Ensure diagrams are clear and easy to understand.
- Use consistent styling and formatting for all diagrams.
- Label all components and relationships clearly.
- Review diagrams for accuracy and completeness before finalizing.
- Update diagrams as necessary when changes are made to the related code or processes.
- Store plantuml files in the `diagrams/` directory for easy access and organization.
- When referencing external resources or systems, include a legend or key to explain symbols used.
- Collaborate with team members to ensure diagrams meet project standards and requirements.
- Utilize plantuml features such as notes, colors, and grouping to enhance diagram clarity.
- Test diagram rendering in different environments to ensure compatibility.
- Document any assumptions or decisions made during the diagram creation process.
